data.title: VERY expensive
data.text: My husband and I stopped by one afternoon to sit and relax for awhile. We each had two beers and soup and the bill was almost $50. with the tip. Not worth it.

data.title: Love this little secret place!
data.text: Delicious food & wine, great music and service!!  Always buy superb wines at great prices to take home too!!

data.title: stopped in to see what happens there
data.text: Great experience. Interesting wines to try, stuff to look at, and buy. Snacked midday on crackers and amazing shrimp and crab dip. Made fresh and hot. Will definitely come back.

data.title: How to do this place...delicious cheeses!
data.text:
Tucked away in Hammock is a little roadside wine and cheese shop where locals gather on Friday nights. Although not QUITE a restaurant, (no dinner or menus), it is a perfect happy hour place after work to sip wine, craft beers, nibble cheeses and listen to local musicians. To me, that's a meal. BUT one must know HOW to do this....we had no clue our first time there, as we are fairly new to the area and looked silly at first, standing around. Writing this so YOU will know better! 
1. Go inside and select your bottle of red wine from the racks. Prices are on the back at the bottom, and are arranged low-high, left to right, by style. Domestic is on the back wall, imports near the door. Whites and bottled beers are in the chiller. Pick up the one(s) you want while you shop.
2. Review the blackboard behind the register for the day's specials and prices. The best choice for 2 is the 3-cheese platter with crackers and dried fruit for $16. They serve A LOT of cheese on this, and we took some home.
3. Select your 3-5 cheeses from the display case. There also is smoked fish dip, hummus and a few other selections in the tall case by the door, as well as gourmet grocery items throughout the store that pair with wine.
4. Pay for your things and go outside, select a table. First come, first serve. A server will bring your food and wine with glasses (not plastic) to you and pour. 
5. There is a seafood vendor on site, but I believe it is raw and for take-home purchase. Not sure how that fit into the mix...
Although open all day, I recommend going after 5 as it is cooler and better ambiance. The night we went, ALL TABLES were full! Solo musicians perform on stage, and I noticed no smoking at the tables. The place closes at 8, but the new manager (owner?) stuck around until most of the patrons were finishing up. It was still hopping at 9 the night we were there. It is a bit pricey (our bill for 2 was $55), but if you buy a cheap bottle or beer, you can do this place for much less. Our cheeses, fish dip and Pinot Noir were all VERY good. We will go again, now that we are "in the know".

data.title: Big Changes
data.text: The Shoppe has been cleaned up and brightened up and re-supplied.  The improvements seem ongoing.  And the fresh fish available out back is fresh and local - not what you can get in the local stores and restaurants.  A bit pricey but worth it if you're a discerning fish buyer.  I understand they have frequent events there and do some catering.  This place is looking more and more interesting.  I'd like to see them enlarge their international cheese selection as that used to be a big draw.

data.title: Shadow of it's former self.
data.text: At one time, this was an excellent place to have a glass of wine and some cheese and let the traffic go on my for a bit. Now, it has gone thru a succession of owners and each time, it dies a little more. The latest iteration is in partnership with a seafood vendor who is selling small volume, little variety seafood out of Styrofoam coolers. Her prices are high, no doubt due to her low volume of sales. We can get the same items from Publix, WD, Anthony's, Seafood Shoppe in St Augustine and Hull's in Ormond but they have lower prices and much more variety. Regarding the wine shop, not much wine anymore. A few racks of wine bottles and not at all like when Gary and Damian owned the place. Where ever you are Gary and Damian, you are in a better place.

data.title: Wine on the A1A in Hammock in Palm Coast
data.text: We stopped by Saturday evening. They were pouring tastes of a Spanish White, a Spanish Garnacha and a French Rose. Decided to buy a bottle of Pinot Noir to share with my wife as my buddy picked up a beer. Too bad they only supply plastic to drink from outside. We sat at a table outside facing A1A. We were still able to hear the guitarist/singer on the side entertainment area. What was unusual for a “wine” establishment was to find so many people outside smoking, the 2 hobbies do not complement each other (maybe it was the beer drinkers…We bought a bottle to take with us and also 3 ¼ pound cheese selections. Would come back here as it is close to where we stayed and their setting is quite nice and the selections varied enough to keep it interesting.

data.title: Terrific place to stop
data.text: We were pleasantly surprised coming from calif and well traveled around Napa Valley and other calif.  wine meccas to find this gem tucked away in the hammock community. Lynda is a perfect hostess and served some delicious choices of cheeses along with wines that were lovely.

data.title: Absolutely fabulous!!!
data.text:
My fiancé and I have driven past this place a hundred times. Even my grandmother has been telling me to stop in there for years!  Finally had the time to swing by and check out their wine and cheese.

We were greeted by Carol, who was an absolute doll!  She was such a sweetheart and very knowledgeable about the cheese and wine.  She was more than happy to let us taste both.  The wine and cheese selection were fabulous.  We bought a triple cream Brie (my favorite) and Manchego (my other favorite). They also had my favorite marcona almonds.  

Wine was a little pricey but the cheese was worth every penny.  Will definitely be back soon for more cheese and later for special occasion wine.  
They also have wine tastings every Friday and Saturday with live music .  Great service and selection for everyone!

data.title: Great evening with entertainment
data.text: Stopped by with family and had a great time.  Nice wine selection and we opened a bottle and kicked back in the patio listening to live entertainment.  Steve is a great guy and very helpful with helping to pick out a wine.

data.title: Good Wine, Good Cheese, Good Music, Great Fun!
data.text:
I visited Hammock Wine & Cheese twice during my 12 day vacation - it was the only place I visited twice and I had a great evening each time.
The wine was good and affordable, the owners funny and amenable and the live music was an unexpectedly pleasurable extra!
There was a really nice mix of regular locals and visitors and all were very friendly - If you go for drinks you still need to make sure you visit the quaint store and the art gallery alongside - if you are really nice to Steve you can twist his arm for a wine bucket for your white wine, if you are planning on staying a while.
I wish the guys all the best with their business - they made my visits one of the highlights of my vacation! Give it a try you won't be disappointed - check which night(s) they are having live music!

data.title: New owners but still terrific
data.text: As vacation home owners in Hammock Beach we fell in love with this place 8 yrs ago - although we miss Damian, it seems that Steve & Elke have taken the wonderful base & built on it. Still have the fab wines & wine tasting & cheese & music. . Like the new approach to art & artists. Maybe bring back the dinners?  But also love the new email campaign - makes me want to get back down to HW&C ASAP!

data.title: Hidden gem!
data.text: Looking for something to do at night in Hammock beach?!?  Well, if you have not yet heard about Hammock wine and cheese shop then its a must have on your to do list!  This hidden gem on A1A not only has a great selection of wine and cheeses but also offers wine tastings and live music Thursday thru Sundays.  Its small, fun and full of great people from around the world.  The owners Steve and Elke sure do know how to show you a good time!  While you are there be sure to check out the house in the back to see who the local artist of the month is.  You never know, there may be something you can't live without!

data.title: What a setting...and amazing selection too!
data.text: This is a great little spot.  We live just down the road in Flagler Beach, and are always looking for pet and family friendly locations.  This fits the bill for both!  They also have live music a few days a week, which is always nice to sit outdoors and enjoy!

data.title: Don't Miss It!
data.text: We live part time in Palm Coast and recently discovered Hammock Wine and Cheese.  Each weekend we are there, we now try to make it over to Hammock Wine and Cheese for wine and cheese tasting.  We always buy a bottle from their vast selection and sit outside to listen to that night's band.  It's always a great way to end the day or start the night.  Love the ambiance and the friendly crowd.  This past weekend, we also bought an original painting from their art gallery.  Steve and Elke are great hosts!  If you're driving down A1A, stop in.  You'll be glad you did!

data.title: If your in Palm Coast you need to go here!
data.text:
I was in Palm Coast recently vacationing with a friend. We were looking for local attractions and we stumbled across this little gem. Its the type of place I don't find very often where three of the things I love in life come together so perfectly!

 Wine - Hammock wine and Cheese Shoppe has a huge selection of great wines from all over the world. I even found one of my favorites from Napa there. 

Cheese - some of the best triple cream Brie you will ever get your hands on. A nice selection of hard and soft cheeses and there carry a nice selection of crackers as well.

 Entertainment - this is what really makes this place special. Several nights while we were there they had local musicians and an outdoor stage in a cozy garden type setting. You can buy a bottle of wine and some cheeses and sit back and enjoy the pairing with local music! It was still cool evening while we were there but they have outdoor heaters and tables where you can sit back and enjoy. I didn't want to leave! They also have a viewing room where local artists can show off their talents and most items are for purchase.

 If your in Palm Coast do yourself a favor and visit this great little mecca.
Tell the owner Steve that Phil,s review on Trip Advisor sent you!
